document_data.name: Mount Akka
document_data.mainbody: '''Mount Akka''' was a mountain in the [[Alpuk]] region of the [[Great Glacier]].
document_data.Geography: Mount Akka was a tall mountain, up to {{SI|1000|ft|long=yes}} in elevation, with a double peak. It was located in the southern edge of the [[Surykyk Range]]. Within the mountain is a network of interconnected caverns.
document_data.Flora & Fauna: Mount Akka was a popular nesting grounds for wild [[kupuk]]. Kupuk made nests and laid their eggs with the caves under the mountain. The caves provided shelter from the weather and protection from predators.
